title: What does Trump mean by 'real history, not fake history'? - Quora

response.answer_text: I’m tempted to re-cast the question as “What does Trump mean by anything?” at this point. More helpfully, Trump’s use of the word “fake” tends to be roughly synonymous with “tells me something I don’t like”. So “fake news” is news which paints Trump and his people in a poor light, “fake polls” are those which suggest that he’s at risk of losing the election in November, and so on. Following that through to its conclusion, “fake history” would be “history which paints something [more than likely the USA] in a poor light.” It’s what’s sometimes referred to as “black armband history” in Australia. The idea is that very few countries have a pure and unsullied record of doing good things. Teaching the history of a given country, therefore, involves looking at the good and the bad. The US has some pretty impressive high points in its history, as well as some really low low points, and you can’t simply ignore the latter in favour of the former. Teaching (or, more charitably, focusing too much on) those low points would appear to be what Trump considers “fake history”.
